voyage_to_stormwreck_isle.title: Voyage to Stormwreck Isle
voyage_to_stormwreck_isle.read_aloud: Your journey has been smooth sailing so far. You left the bustling port of Neverwinter a few days ago, heading for an island with the foreboding name of Stormwreck Isle. But you woke this morning to a blood-red sunrise, and dark clouds overhead threaten a violent storm.
voyage_to_stormwreck_isle.gm_guidance: Introduce the players to the setting and the impending storm. Use the illustration of the ship at sea to enhance the atmosphere.

edges.label: A monster hauls itself onto the deck

merrow_encounter.title: Merrow Encounter
merrow_encounter.read_aloud: As lightning flashes across the sky, a monster hauls itself up onto the deck! 'These waters belong to the Scaled Queen. I’m here to collect her tribute.'
merrow_encounter.gm_guidance: The merrow demands 400 gp as tribute. Players can negotiate using Charisma checks (DC 15) to reduce the amount by 100 gp per success. If players ask about the Scaled Queen, the merrow describes her as a huge, two-headed merrow blessed by Demogorgon. If players attack, the merrow fights back but is not a significant threat, likely defeated in 1-2 rounds. Encourage creative solutions and use vivid descriptions.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The merrow makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.

arrival_at_dragons_rest.title: Arrival at Dragon's Rest
arrival_at_dragons_rest.read_aloud: Stormwreck Isle—now visible off the bow—promises rare wonders. Seaweed shimmers in countless brilliant colors below you, and rays of sunlight defy the overcast sky to illuminate the lush grass and dark basalt rock of the island. Avoiding the rocks jutting up from the ocean, your ship makes its way toward a calm harbor on the island’s north side.
arrival_at_dragons_rest.gm_guidance: Describe the approach to Dragon's Rest and the temple. Encourage players to introduce their characters and discuss their reasons for visiting. Note the party's marching order as they prepare to head to the cloister.

drowned_sailors_encounter.title: Drowned Sailors
drowned_sailors_encounter.read_aloud: As you’re about to leave the beach and start your climb, you hear a ruckus of splashing and a wet, gurgling moan behind you. Three figures are shambling up from the water’s edge, about thirty feet away. They’re dressed as sailors, but their skin is gray and they look drowned. Sea water drools from their slack mouths as they lurch toward you.
drowned_sailors_encounter.gm_guidance: The zombies are slow and can be avoided. If players choose to fight, use initiative to determine order. Zombies have Undead Fortitude, making them hard to kill unless hit with radiant damage or a critical hit. If players struggle, Elder Runara rescues them. If players avoid the zombies, they can continue to Dragon's Rest.

stats.name: Zombie
stats.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can’t speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it makes a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.description: The zombie doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

interactions.success: Recall that radiant damage or critical hits can defeat zombies

dragons_rest_temple.title: Dragon's Rest Temple
dragons_rest_temple.read_aloud: The ship drops anchor at the mouth of the harbor, and two sailors row you ashore. You have plenty of time to admire the towering statue at the center of the temple, depicting a wizened man surrounded by seven songbirds. A long path winds up the side of the cliff to the temple, dotted along the way with doorways cut into the rock.
dragons_rest_temple.gm_guidance: Encourage players to explore the temple and interact with Elder Runara. Discuss their reasons for visiting and any personal quests. Prepare for the next section of the adventure.

characters.name: Unnamed
characters.background_story: You trained as a soldier on the island of Mintarn and joined a mercenary company. You traveled to the city of Neverwinter with your company to serve in both the army and the city watch.
characters.personality_traits: Certain of your deity’s wishes, you resigned your post and set out on your quest.
characters.ideals: Responsibility and loyalty to your allies.
